item.title: 英国迎来夏季第三次热浪，气温将达到峰值
item.description: 预报员说，今夏第三次热浪将在周六达到顶峰，英国部分地区的最高气温可能超过 34 摄氏度。【原文：The third heatwave of the summer is set to peak on Saturday, forecasters said, with highs of more than 34C possible in parts of the UK.】

item.title: 美国的防洪数学问题
item.description:
今天的 "Big Take "播客：气候变化如何使洪水变得更加致命、代价更高—；以及面临风险的社区所面临的艰难经济选择。【原文：

On today’s Big Take podcast: how climate change is making floods deadlier and costlier — and the difficult economic choices facing communities at risk.

】

item.title: 通用电气弗诺瓦公司为损坏的风叶向南塔基特岛赔偿 1050 万美元
item.description: 去年，通用电气弗诺瓦公司（GE Vernova）的一个海上风力涡轮机叶片碎裂并被冲上岸，该公司将向南塔基特岛社区支付 1050 万美元。【原文：GE Vernova will pay $10.5 million to the island community of Nantucket after one of its offshore wind turbine blades broke into pieces and washed ashore last year.】

item.title: 热到什么程度？科学家们的看法
item.description: 我们的 "酷热周 "报道仍在继续，今天的时事通讯将从科学角度探讨世界究竟会变得有多热。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享全文。【原文：As our Heat Week coverage continues, today’s newsletter looks at how hot the world can actually get, scientifically speaking. You can also read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 天气能有多热？科学家正在努力寻找答案
item.description:
随着地球变暖，弄清异常高温是如何上升的变得更加重要。【原文：

Figuring out how anomalously high temperatures can rise is taking on added importance as the planet warms.

】

item.title: 汇丰银行退出被华尔街抛弃的银行气候联盟
item.description: 汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）退出了全球最大的银行气候联盟，在过去八个月里，美国最大的贷款机构纷纷出走，使该联盟备受冲击。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc has left the world’s biggest climate alliance for banks, which was rocked over the past eight months by an exodus of the biggest US lenders.】

item.title: 特斯拉可能从八月起在印度开始首批交付
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，特斯拉公司将于本周二在印度开设第一家展厅，最早将于下个月开始交付产品，这家由埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）领导的电动汽车制造商希望挖掘印度这个第三大汽车市场的潜在需求，以应对其他地区销售放缓的局面。【原文：Tesla Inc. will open its first showroom in India on Tuesday and begin deliveries as early as next month, according to people familiar with the matter, as the Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker looks to tap potential demand in the third-largest automobile market to counter slowing sales elsewhere.】

item.title: 西班牙、希腊天气警报持续，欧洲陷入炎热之中
item.description: 炎热、晴朗的天气正在欧洲大部分地区蔓延，下周西班牙部分地区将出现更极端的气温。【原文：Hot, sunny weather is spreading across most of Europe with more extreme temperatures due next week in parts of Spain.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将 "务实 "监管银行的碳过渡计划
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）表示，在贷款机构准备法律规定的如何向低碳经济过渡的计划时，不会立即对其提出严格要求。【原文：The European Central Bank signaled that it won’t immediately hold lenders to strict demands as they prepare legally-mandated plans for how they will accompany the move to a low carbon-economy.】

item.title: 今夏保持室内凉爽的 10 种方法
item.description:
由气候引起的热浪正变得越来越强烈、频繁和致命。以下是为您的房屋提供温度防护的小贴士。

 

Climate-driven heat waves are becoming more intense, frequent and deadly. Here are tips to temperature-proof your house. 

 

】

item.title: 研究发现：审计师未能发挥保护碳市场的作用
item.description: 新的学术研究表明，审计师作为碳抵消质量的第三方保证人，其作用正在失效。【原文：Auditors are failing in their role as third-party guarantors of the quality of carbon offsets, according to new academic research.】

item.title: 美国有望在 2026 年批准田纳西河流域管理局核反应堆项目
item.description: 随着电力需求的激增，核管理委员会预计将在 2026 年底前批准田纳西流域管理局建造一座小型核反应堆的计划。【原文：The Nuclear Regulatory Commission expects to approve by the end of 2026 Tennessee Valley Authority’s plan to build a small nuclear reactor, as demand for electricity surges.】

item.title: 特朗普第二任期头几个月油气管道安全案件骤降
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推动精简政府和削减繁文缛节，美国为确保石油和天然气管道安全而采取的监管行动骤降至总统任期伊始的新低。【原文：US regulatory actions to ensure oil and gas pipeline safety have plummeted to a record low for the start of a presidential administration as Donald Trump pushes to streamline the government and cut red tape.】

item.title: 外国公司比以往任何时候都更主导美国 ESG 市场
item.description: 今年，外国公司比以往任何时候都更热衷于在美国市场上发行可持续债券，因为政治反弹和微不足道的定价优势继续让美国公司保持观望。【原文：The US market for sustainable bonds is being crowded by foreign companies this year more than ever, as political backlash and negligible pricing benefits continue to keep American companies on the sidelines.】

item.title: 波士顿电池制造商迁至芝加哥，普利兹克获胜
item.description: 电池制造商 Pure Lithium Corp. 将把业务从波士顿迁至芝加哥，伊利诺伊州州长 JB Pritzker 又一次赢得了胜利。【原文：Battery manufacturer Pure Lithium Corp. will move its operations to Chicago from Boston, handing Illinois Governor JB Pritzker another win.】

item.title: 威胁生命的热气球让预报员无所适从
item.description:
科学家们正在努力寻找大气预警信号，以便在更长的时间内预测极端高温将在何时何地出现。【原文：

Scientists are working to find atmospheric warning signs that can provide a longer lead time to forecast where and when extreme heat will hit.

】

item.title: 欧洲再现高温，希腊野火迫使居民撤离
item.description: 在炎热干燥的天气中，希腊各地大火肆虐，雅典附近地区和塔索斯岛的居民被迫撤离。【原文：Fires raged across Greece amid hot and dry weather, forcing evacuations in an area near Athens as well as on the island of Thasos.】

item.title: 为什么武装部队不能再忽视气候变化？
item.description:
英国陆军退役中将理查德-努格（Richard Nugee）认为，为了国家安全和地球，国防部门需要拥抱绿色转型。【原文：

Defense departments need to embrace the green transition for national security and the planet, argues Richard Nugee, retired lieutenant general of the British Army.

】

item.title: 尽管政府做出了努力，但酷热仍在夺走欧洲工人的生命
item.description:
西班牙和希腊多年来一直限制在酷暑天进行户外工作，而意大利和法国则从今年夏天开始。【原文：

Spain and Greece have for years restricted outdoor work on very hot days, while Italy and France have started this summer.

】

item.title: 普拉博沃称印尼可在 2035 年实现 100% 可再生能源目标
item.description: 印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）表示，印尼的目标是在未来十年中期完全过渡到可再生能源，这远远早于该国此前宣布的目标。【原文：Indonesia aims to transition entirely to renewable energy by the middle of the coming decade, according to President Prabowo Subianto, well ahead of the country’s previously announced goal.】

item.title: 比亚迪和其他电动汽车电池制造商面临更大的减排压力
item.description: 环保组织绿色和平（Greenpeace）表示，包括比亚迪股份有限公司（BYD Co.【原文：Electric vehicle battery suppliers, including BYD Co. and EVE Energy Co., need to step up efforts to switch to clean power at manufacturing sites and curb emissions in supply chains, according to environmental group Greenpeace.】

item.title: 很少有遭受特大暴雨袭击的得克萨斯州房主购买洪水保险
item.description:
随着气候变化导致风暴加剧，覆盖面不足的问题越来越严重。【原文：

The lack of coverage is becoming more problematic as climate change intensifies storms.

】

item.title: 克里斯蒂-诺姆（Kristi Noem）在得克萨斯州洪灾后仍再次呼吁取消联邦紧急事务管理局（FEMA
item.description: 国土安全部长克里斯蒂.诺姆（Kristi Noem）再次呼吁对联邦紧急事务管理局进行全面改革，即使该机构在得克萨斯州发生灾难性洪灾并造成 100 多人死亡之后仍在帮助开展搜索和恢复工作。【原文：Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem reiterated her call to overhaul the Federal Emergency Management Agency, even as the organization helps in search and recovery efforts following the catastrophic flooding in Texas that’s left more than 100 people dead.】

item.title: 参议员在得克萨斯州洪灾和特朗普税收法案之际发出气候警告
item.description:
谢尔顿-怀特豪斯（Sheldon Whitehouse）将于本周三就气候问题发表第300次演讲，这距离国会取消清洁能源激励措施还不到一周时间。【原文：

Sheldon Whitehouse will give his 300th floor speech on climate on Wednesday, less than a week after Congress rolled back clean energy incentives.

】

item.title: 投票失败后，欧盟极右翼将制定 2040 年气候目标
item.description: 欧洲议会中的一个极右翼团体将对欧盟 2040 年气候目标的制定产生影响，此前，立法者们在周三首次试图限制该团体在谈判中的作用，但未能收集到足够的选票。【原文：A far-right group in the European Parliament is set to have influence over shaping the European Union’s 2040 climate goals, after lawmakers on Wednesday failed to gather enough votes in their first attempt to curb its role in negotiations.】

item.title: 马赛大火在造成 100 多人受伤后开始退烧
item.description: 马赛边缘的一场大火在造成 100 多人受伤、迫使居民撤离并摧毁了一些房屋后开始退却。【原文：A huge wildfire on the edges of Marseille started to retreat after injuring more than 100 people, forcing residents to evacuate and destroying a number of homes.】

item.title: 西欧刚刚迎来有史以来最温暖的六月
item.description:
根据欧洲地球观测机构哥白尼的数据，上个月的气温比1991年至2020年间的平均气温高出两摄氏度多。【原文：

Last month was more than two degrees Celsius hotter than the average between 1991 and 2020, according to Europe’s Earth observation agency Copernicus.

】

item.title: 新加坡甘氏称气候前景十年来最不确定
item.description: 新加坡副总理甘金勇表示，自2015年达成《巴黎协定》以来，应对气候变化的行动正面临着最不确定的全球背景。【原文：Action to tackle climate change is facing the most uncertain global backdrop since the Paris Agreement was struck in 2015, according to Singapore’s Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong.】

item.title: 据说 ADIA 和 OTPP 正在考虑出售亚洲可再生能源公司 Equis
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿布扎比投资局和安大略教师退休金计划委员会正在考虑出售亚太地区可再生能源开发商 Equis Development Pte。【原文：The Abu Dhabi Investment Authority and Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan Board are considering a sale of Asia-Pacific renewable energy developer Equis Development Pte, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 创业板指中国在经济放缓后加快海上风电项目建设
item.description: 据《全球能源观察》报道，随着中国海上风电行业从 2021 年国家补贴结束后的放缓中复苏，中国已重建了一个庞大的海上风电项目管道。【原文：China has rebuilt a substantial pipeline of offshore wind projects as the sector recovers from a slowdown that followed the end of national subsidies in 2021, according to Global Energy Monitor.】
